ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to work on a larger project and to write a longer paper. I learned how to do original research and to write my thoughts in a coherent way. The senior essay is much more than simply a long essay. It's a different kind of work that I appreciate having the opportunity to do.
learned better how to present, write a huge paper, research... all the things you'd hope for with your thesis!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The senior essay is a great learning experience. It is mostly strengths. The two things I wish, though, were instead of class wide workshops, I wish we had one on one peer editing sessions instead. I also wish the timeline was structured differently. I wish we had less buildup and more check-ins with actual words on paper.
could be improved by more meeting times, more intermediate deadlines

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You gotta do it. If you write a yearlong essay, please do yourself a favor and plan to write an essay that takes half a year. Trust me. Treat it like an extended seminar paper and play it safe. Do not, I repeat, do not (!!!) try to write an overly complex or experimental or creative paper. This, young grasshopper, is a recipe for disaster. Please benefit from my mistakes!
yes! it's a requirement... but prof. Raab was wonderful to work with
